alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:54PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Huerfano, eastern Costilla and western Las Animas Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of San Luis, or 16 miles southwest of Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, Cuchara, southern Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county and La Veta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
